title: Meta debuts generative AI features for advertisers
author: Sarah Perez
content: Meta announced today it is rolling out its first generative AI features for advertisers, allowing them to use AI to create backgrounds, expand images, and generate multiple versions of ad text...
content2: In a bold move that signifies the growing influence of artificial intelligence (AI) in the digital advertising realm, Meta, formerly known as Facebook, has recently introduced generative AI features for advertisers. This groundbreaking development aims to revolutionize the way brands connect with their target audiences, enhancing creativity and personalization in advertising campaigns. This move by Meta reflects the company's commitment to staying at the forefront of technological advancements and delivering innovative solutions for its advertisers
content3: Generative AI, a subset of artificial intelligence, involves the use of algorithms to create new content autonomously. In the context of advertising, this technology opens up new possibilities for creativity, efficiency, and engagement. Meta's decision to integrate generative AI features into its advertising platform marks a significant shift in the industry, offering advertisers a powerful tool to captivate audiences in unique and personalized ways.

title: Making wearable medical devices more patient-friendly with Professor Esther Rodriguez-Villegas from Acurable
author: Darrell Etherington
content: Welcome back to Found, where we get the stories behind the startups. This week, our old friend Darrell Etherington joins Becca Szkutak to talk with Professor Esther Rodriguez-Villegas from Acurable...
content2: In the rapidly evolving landscape of healthcare technology, wearable medical devices are playing an increasingly significant role in monitoring and managing various health conditions. These devices provide valuable insights into patients' well-being, enabling healthcare professionals to offer more personalized and efficient care. One notable figure contributing to this revolution is Professor Esther Rodriguez-Villegas, a leading expert in the field and a key contributor to Acurable, a company dedicated to advancing wearable medical technology.
content3: Professor Esther Rodriguez-Villegas is a distinguished figure in the field of electronic engineering and medical technology. Her groundbreaking work has significantly influenced the development of wearable devices that cater to the unique needs and preferences of patients. As the Chief Technology Officer of Acurable, she leads a team dedicated to creating innovative solutions that bridge the gap between technology and patient-friendly healthcare.

title: Rainforest raises $8.5M to help software companies embed financial services, payments
author: Mary Ann Azevedo
content: In November 2019, Andreessen Horowitz General Partner Angela Strange famously declared that, “Every company will be a fintech company.” Specifically, Strange projected that — in the not-too-d...
content2: Rainforest, a leading player in the tech industry, has recently raised an impressive $8.5 million in a funding round aimed at expanding its mission to empower software companies with seamless integration of financial services and payments. This funding milestone marks a significant step forward for Rainforest, enabling the company to enhance its capabilities and support the growing demand for comprehensive solutions within the ever-evolving landscape of financial technology
content3: Rainforest, a leading player in the tech industry, has recently raised an impressive $8.5 million in a funding round aimed at expanding its mission to empower software companies with seamless integration of financial services and payments. This funding milestone marks a significant step forward for Rainforest, enabling the company to enhance its capabilities and support the growing demand for comprehensive solutions within the ever-evolving landscape of financial technology.

title: Pow.bio says biomanufacturing is broken and its continuous fermentation tech will fix it
author: Christine Hall
content: Pow.bio intends to bring down the costs associated with biomanufacturing by reimagining of fermentation facility operations.

title: Recapitalization, $60M Series D support growth of e-commerce financier Clearco
author: Christine Hall
content: Today is news marks a turnaround for a company that is had its share of ups and downs over the past year.
content2: In a strategic move to bolster its position in the rapidly evolving e-commerce financing landscape, Clearco has successfully raised $60 million in a Series D round of funding. The funding round, led by prominent investors, signifies a vote of confidence in Clearco's business model and highlights the growing importance of e-commerce financing solutions in the global market.
content3: The e-commerce sector has witnessed exponential growth in recent years, accelerated by shifts in consumer behavior and the digital transformation of retail. Clearco's role in providing accessible and data-driven financing options positions it as a crucial ally for e-commerce entrepreneurs navigating the challenges of scaling their businesses.

title: Rabbit is building an AI model that understands how software works
author: Kyle Wiggers
content: What if you could interact with any piece of software using natural language? Imagine typing in a prompt and having AI translate the instructions into machine-comprehendable commands, executing tas...
content2: In the ever-evolving landscape of technology, artificial intelligence (AI) continues to push the boundaries of what machines can achieve. One company, Rabbit, is on a groundbreaking journey to develop an AI model that comprehensively understands how software works. This ambitious venture has the potential to revolutionize the way humans interact with technology, bridging the gap between developers and AI systems.
content3: Rabbit's vision is to create an AI model that goes beyond traditional machine learning capabilities. Instead of merely recognizing patterns or making predictions, this model aims to understand the intricate workings of software at a deep and meaningful level. The goal is to empower the AI to not only interpret code but to comprehend the underlying logic, dependencies, and relationships within software systems.

title: Okta plans to weave AI across its entire identity platform using multiple models
author: Ron Miller
content: One thing is clear this year: generative AI is having a tremendous impact on the software industry, and a week doesn’t pass without software companies announcing their plans to incorporate the seem...
content2: In the ever-evolving landscape of cybersecurity and identity management, Okta, a leading identity and access management (IAM) provider, is taking a bold step forward. Okta has unveiled plans to integrate artificial intelligence (AI) across its entire identity platform, leveraging the power of multiple models. This strategic move aims to enhance security, user experience, and overall efficiency for businesses relying on Okta's solutions,
content3: As the digital realm expands, organizations face increasingly sophisticated cyber threats. Identity management has become a crucial aspect of cybersecurity, ensuring that the right individuals have access to the right resources at the right time. AI, with its ability to analyze vast datasets and detect patterns, is proving to be a game-changer in bolstering the security posture of identity platforms

title: You can now add PayPal and Venmo credit or debit cards to your Apple Wallet
author: Sarah Perez
content: PayPal announced today that users can now add their PayPal and Venmo credit or debit cards to their Apple Wallet. With this new integration, you can now make payments in-store, online or on apps using Apple Pay. The company notes that users will continue earning their cashback and rewards.
